Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Lakers opened the preseason with a 124-107 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Pre-Game Insights: Bronny James called his preseason debut a 'game for new beginnings' and 'feeling things out.'
James will make his second preseason appearance for the Lakers on Sunday against the Phoenix Suns, which he said would be a 'full-circle moment.'
Post-Match Reflections: James recorded two points, an assist and a rebound while leading the team with three blocks in the loss.
Lakers first-year head coach J.J. Redick praised James after the game as a'really disruptive defender.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bronny James' preseason debut marked the first time he has suited up for a Lakers game.
James will hope to see similar growth in his game as his preseason continues.
The Lakers will have four preseason contests remaining before the Oct. 22 preseason opener against the Timberwolves.
Others: Bronny James averaged seven points on 32.7 percent shooting from the field in six Summer League games.
James improved over his final two Summer League contests, totaling 25 points on 10-of-21 shooting.
